intro: Podospermum persepolitanum, commonly known as the Persian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, displaying shades of purple or pink. Podospermum persepolitanum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
